alert.note: Alert for Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 9:13PM PDT until August 25 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT... .An upper level low will bring the chance for thunderstorms to Trinity, eastern Humboldt, western Siskiyou, and Del Norte counties Thursday afternoon into the first half of the overnight. Thunderstorms will be moving to the north-northwest. Brief periods of heavy rain are possible, but with the fast motion of these storms wetting rains is limited. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THURSDAY TO 2 AM PDT FRIDAY... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 201.Fire weather zone 203.Fire weather zone 204.Fire weather zone 211.Fire weather zone 212.Fire weather zone 283. * THUNDERSTORMS...A 20 to 30 percent chance of thunderstorms with abundant lightning developing Thursday afternoon, moving north- northwest from Trinity County into northern Humboldt, western Siskiyou, and Del Norte counties. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Erratic outflow wind gusts up to 40 mph. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Hoopa; Lower Middle Klamath; North Coast; Trinity; Upper Smith; Van Duzen, Mad River
